Aabb

Aabb

Aabb

Body

Body

Body

b2CreateBody

Creates a new physics body in the specified world based on the provided body definition. The body is added to the appropriate solver set based on its type and state. The function initializes the body's physical properties including position, rotation, velocities, damping values and other simulation parameters.

b2CreateBody(worldId: b2WorldId, def: b2BodyDef): b2BodyId
Parameters
worldId (b2WorldId) The ID of the world to create the body in
def (b2BodyDef) The body definition containing initialization parameters
Returns
b2BodyId: The ID of the newly created body
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion errors if:
    • Position vector is invalid
    • Rotation value is invalid
    • Linear velocity vector is invalid
    • Angular velocity is invalid
    • Linear damping is invalid or negative
    • Angular damping is invalid or negative
    • Sleep threshold is invalid or negative
    • Gravity scale is invalid

b2DestroyBody

Destroys a body and all associated joints, contacts, shapes, and chains in the physics world. The function cleans up all resources and removes the body from the simulation system.

b2DestroyBody(bodyId: b2BodyId): void
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The identifier of the body to destroy
Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion errors if body indices are invalid during removal

b2Body_GetContactCapacity

Retrieves the current number of contacts associated with the specified body. The function first validates the world reference before accessing the body's contact count.

b2Body_GetContactCapacity(bodyId: b2BodyId): number
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The identifier for the body to query
Returns
number: The number of contacts associated with the body. Returns 0 if the world is invalid.

b2Body_GetContactData

Retrieves contact data for a specified body. For each active contact, stores the shape IDs of both bodies involved and the contact manifold. Only stores contacts that have the touching flag set.

b2Body_GetContactData(bodyId: b2BodyId, contactData: Array<b2ContactData>, capacity: number): number
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The ID of the body to get contact data from
contactData (Array<b2ContactData>) Array to store the contact data
capacity (number) Maximum number of contacts to retrieve
Returns
number: The number of contacts stored in contactData
Throws
  • Error: If the world is locked or invalid

b2Body_ComputeAABB

For bodies with no shapes, returns an AABB containing only the body's position. For bodies with shapes, computes the union of AABBs of all shapes attached to the body.

b2Body_ComputeAABB(bodyId: b2BodyId): b2AABB
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The identifier for the body whose AABB is to be computed.
Returns
b2AABB: An AABB that encompasses the body and all its shapes. Returns an empty AABB if the world is not found.

b2Body_GetPosition

Retrieves the current position component of a body's transform from the physics world. The position is returned as a b2Vec2 representing the body's location in world space.

b2Body_GetPosition(bodyId: b2BodyId): b2Vec2
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The identifier for the body whose position is being queried.
Returns
b2Vec2: The position vector of the body in world coordinates.

b2Body_GetRotation

Retrieves the rotation component (q) from the body's transform. The returned b2Rot object represents the body's angular orientation in 2D space.

b2Body_GetRotation(bodyId: b2BodyId): b2Rot
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The identifier for the body whose rotation is being queried.
Returns
b2Rot: A rotation object containing the cosine and sine of the body's angle.

b2Body_GetTransform

Retrieves the current transform (position and rotation) of a physics body from the specified Box2D world using the body's identifier.

b2Body_GetTransform(bodyId: Object): Object
Parameters
bodyId (Object) The identifier object for the body, containing world reference.
Name Description
bodyId.world0 number The world identifier.
Returns
Object: The body's transform containing:
  • position {b2Vec2} The position vector (x, y)
  • rotation {b2Rot} The rotation values (c, s)

b2Body_GetLocalPoint

Takes a point given in world coordinates and converts it to the body's local coordinate system by applying the inverse of the body's transform.

b2Body_GetLocalPoint(bodyId: b2BodyId, worldPoint: b2Vec2): b2Vec2
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The identifier for the body
worldPoint (b2Vec2) A point in world coordinates
Returns

Retrieves the current linear velocity of a body from its state in the physics world. If the body state cannot be found, returns a zero vector. Linear velocity is often used for calculations (damping, direction, etc) and must be cloned to avoid unwanted effects in the Physics engine.

Updates a body's type and handles all necessary simulation changes including:

  • Destroying existing contacts
  • Waking the body and connected bodies
  • Unlinking and relinking joints
  • Transferring the body between solver sets
  • Updating broad-phase proxies
  • Recalculating mass data If the body is disabled or the type is unchanged, minimal processing occurs. Special handling exists for transitions to/from static body type.

b2Body_Disable

Disables a body in the physics simulation by removing it from its current solver set and moving it to the disabled set. The function removes all contacts associated with the body, removes it from any island it belongs to, destroys shape proxies in the broad phase, and transfers associated joints to the disabled set.

b2Body_Disable(bodyId: b2BodyId): void
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The identifier of the body to disable
Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws if the world is locked or invalid

b2Body_Enable

Enables a previously disabled body in the physics world. When enabled, the body's shapes are added to the broad-phase collision system, and its joints are reconnected to the simulation. The body is moved from the disabled set to either the static set or awake set based on its type.

b2Body_Enable(bodyId: b2BodyId): void
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The identifier of the body to enable
Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if joint connectivity validation fails

DebugDraw

DebugDraw

CreateDebugDraw

Creates a debug drawing interface for Box2D that renders shapes to a canvas context.
The canvas is automatically sized to 1280x720 or 720x1280 based on window orientation.
All coordinates are transformed from Box2D world space to screen space.
This feature isn't meant for production. It is purely for debugging and testing. The code is not optimized, stable or extensible. Implement your own drawing code for production.

CreateDebugDraw(canvas: HTMLCanvasElement, ctx: CanvasRenderingContext2D, scale: number): b2DebugDraw
Parameters
canvas (HTMLCanvasElement) The canvas element to draw on
ctx (CanvasRenderingContext2D) The 2D rendering context for the canvas
scale (number = 20) The scale factor to convert Box2D coordinates to pixels
Returns
b2DebugDraw: A debug draw instance with methods for rendering Box2D shapes The debug draw instance includes methods for drawing:
  • Polygons (outlined and filled)
  • Circles (outlined and filled)
  • Capsules (outlined and filled)
  • Images mapped to shapes
  • Line segments
  • Points
  • Transforms

RAF

Creates an animation loop using requestAnimationFrame that tracks timing information and FPS. The callback is invoked each frame with the time delta, total time, and current FPS. Frame delta time is capped at 100ms to avoid large time steps.

RAF(callback: function)
Parameters
callback (function) Function to call each frame with signature (deltaTime, totalTime, currentFps)
Name Description
callback.deltaTime number Time elapsed since last frame in seconds, capped at 0.1s
callback.totalTime number Total accumulated time in seconds
callback.currentFps number Current frames per second, updated once per second

AttachImage

Attaches an image to the last shape of a Box2D body. The function loads a PNG image asynchronously and sets up drawing parameters including offset, scale, and source rectangle coordinates. The image is stored in the shape's properties for later rendering.

AttachImage(worldId: number, bodyId: number, path: string, imgName: string, drawOffset: b2Vec2, drawScale: b2Vec2, sourcePosition: b2Vec2, sourceSize: b2Vec2): Object
Parameters
worldId (number) The ID of the Box2D world
bodyId (number) The ID of the body to attach the image to
path (string) Directory path where the image is located
imgName (string) Name of the image file
drawOffset (b2Vec2 = null) Offset vector for drawing the image
drawScale (b2Vec2 = null) Scale vector for drawing the image
sourcePosition (b2Vec2 = null) Position in the source image to start drawing from
sourceSize (b2Vec2 = null) Size of the region to draw from the source image
Returns
Object: The modified shape object with attached image properties

ConvertScreenToWorld

Converts screen/canvas coordinates to world space coordinates in the Box2D physics system.

ConvertScreenToWorld(canvas: HTMLCanvasElement, drawScale: number, ps: Object): b2Vec2
Parameters
canvas (HTMLCanvasElement) The canvas element being used for rendering
drawScale (number) The scale factor between screen and world coordinates
ps (Object) The screen position coordinates
Returns
b2Vec2: A vector containing the world space coordinates
Example
// Convert mouse click position to world coordinates
const worldPos = ConvertScreenToWorld(myCanvas, 30, mousePos);

ConvertWorldToScreen

Transforms a position from world space to screen space, taking into account the canvas dimensions, aspect ratio, and zoom level. The function maps the world coordinates to normalized coordinates (0-1) and then scales them to screen pixels.

ConvertWorldToScreen(canvas: HTMLCanvasElement, drawScale: number, pw: b2Vec2): b2Vec2
Parameters

b2GetSweepTransform

Calculates an intermediate transform by linearly interpolating between two states defined in a sweep motion. The resulting transform accounts for both translation and rotation, adjusted by the local center offset.

b2GetSweepTransform(sweep: b2Sweep, time: number): b2Transform
Parameters
sweep (b2Sweep) A sweep object containing initial (c1, q1) and final (c2, q2) positions and rotations, along with a local center offset.
time (number) Interpolation factor between 0 and 1, where 0 represents the initial state and 1 represents the final state.
Returns
b2Transform: A transform object containing the interpolated position (p) and rotation (q) at the specified time.

b2SegmentDistance

Calculates the minimum distance between two line segments defined by their endpoints.

b2SegmentDistance(p1X: number, p1Y: number, q1X: number, q1Y: number, p2X: number, p2Y: number, q2X: number, q2Y: number): b2SegmentDistanceResult
Parameters

p1Y (number) Y coordinate of the first point of segment 1

q1Y (number) Y coordinate of the second point of segment 1
p2X (number) X coordinate of the first point of segment 2
p2Y (number) Y coordinate of the first point of segment 2
q2X (number) X coordinate of the second point of segment 2
q2Y (number) Y coordinate of the second point of segment 2
Returns
b2SegmentDistanceResult: An object containing:
  • fraction1: {number} Parameter along segment 1 for closest point (0-1)
  • fraction2: {number} Parameter along segment 2 for closest point (0-1)

b2ShapeDistance

Computes the distance between two convex shapes using the GJK (Gilbert-Johnson-Keerthi) algorithm.

b2ShapeDistance(cache: b2DistanceCache, input: b2DistanceInput, simplexes: Array<b2Simplex>, simplexCapacity: number): b2DistanceOutput
Parameters
cache (b2DistanceCache) Cache object to store and retrieve simplex data between calls
input (b2DistanceInput) Input parameters containing:
  • proxyA: First shape proxy
  • proxyB: Second shape proxy
  • transformA: Transform for first shape
  • transformB: Transform for second shape
  • useRadii: Boolean flag for including shape radii in calculation
simplexes (Array<b2Simplex>) Optional array to store simplex history
simplexCapacity (number) Maximum number of simplexes to store
Returns
b2DistanceOutput: Output containing:
  • pointA: Closest point on shape A
  • pointB: Closest point on shape B
  • distance: Distance between the shapes
  • iterations: Number of iterations performed
  • simplexCount: Number of simplexes stored

b2ShapeCast

Uses an iterative algorithm to determine if and when two convex shapes will collide during a linear motion. Shape B is translated while shape A remains stationary. The algorithm uses support points and simplexes to determine the closest points between the shapes.

b2ShapeCast(input: b2ShapeCastPairInput): b2CastOutput
Parameters
input (b2ShapeCastPairInput) Contains: proxyA - First shape proxy proxyB - Second shape proxy transformA - Transform of first shape transformB - Transform of second shape translationB - Translation vector for second shape maxFraction - Maximum fraction of motion to check
Returns
b2CastOutput: Contains: fraction - Time of impact fraction [0,maxFraction] point - Point of impact normal - Surface normal at impact iterations - Number of iterations used hit - Whether a collision was detected

b2TimeOfImpact

Computes when two moving shapes first collide during their motion sweeps. Uses conservative advancement and binary search to find the first time of impact or determine that no impact occurs during the time interval.

b2TimeOfImpact(input: b2TOIInput): b2TOIOutput
Parameters
input (b2TOIInput) Input parameters containing:
  • proxyA: First shape proxy
  • proxyB: Second shape proxy
  • sweepA: Motion sweep for first shape
  • sweepB: Motion sweep for second shape
  • tMax: Maximum time interval
Returns
b2TOIOutput: Output containing:
  • state: The termination state (Unknown, Failed, Overlapped, Hit, Separated)
  • t: Time of impact (between 0 and tMax)
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion error if input sweeps are not normalized

DynamicTree

DynamicTree

DynamicTree

b2DynamicTree_Create

Creates a b2DynamicTree data structure used for efficient spatial partitioning. The tree is initialized with a pre-allocated pool of nodes linked in a free list.

b2DynamicTree_Create(): b2DynamicTree
Returns
b2DynamicTree: A new dynamic tree with:
  • Initial node capacity of 16
  • Empty root (B2_NULL_INDEX)
  • Initialized node array with parent/next pointers
  • All nodes set to height -1
  • Free list starting at index 0
  • Zero proxy count
  • Null leaf indices and centers
  • Zero rebuild capacity

b2DynamicTree_Destroy

Clears the nodes, leaf indices, and leaf centers arrays of the dynamic tree, effectively destroying the tree's data structure.

b2DynamicTree_Destroy(tree: b2DynamicTree): void
Parameters
tree (b2DynamicTree) The dynamic tree to destroy.
Returns
void:

b2DynamicTree_CreateProxy

Creates a proxy in a dynamic tree for collision detection. The proxy is added as a leaf node.

b2DynamicTree_CreateProxy(tree: b2DynamicTree, aabb: b2AABB, categoryBits: number, userData: number): number
Parameters
tree (b2DynamicTree) The dynamic tree to add the proxy to
aabb (b2AABB) The axis-aligned bounding box for the proxy
categoryBits (number) The collision category bits for filtering
userData (number) User data associated with this proxy
Returns
number: The ID of the created proxy node
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion error if AABB bounds are outside valid range

b2DynamicTree_DestroyProxy

Removes a leaf node from the tree, frees the node's memory, and decrements the proxy count. The proxy must be a valid leaf node in the tree.

b2DynamicTree_DestroyProxy(tree: b2DynamicTree, proxyId: number): void
Parameters
tree (b2DynamicTree) The dynamic tree containing the proxy
proxyId (number) The ID of the proxy to destroy (must be >= 0 and < nodeCapacity)
Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if:
    • proxyId is out of bounds
    • the node is not a leaf
    • the tree has no proxies

    • The proxyId is out of bounds

Parameters

Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion errors if:
    • The AABB is invalid
    • The AABB dimensions exceed B2_HUGE
    • The proxyId is out of bounds
    • The node is not a leaf
    • The new AABB is contained within the old one

b2DynamicTree_GetHeight

Returns the height of the specified dynamic tree by accessing the height property of the root node. The height represents the maximum number of levels from the root to any leaf node.

b2DynamicTree_GetHeight(tree: b2DynamicTree): number

Returns

Computes the sum of all internal node perimeters (excluding leaves and root) divided by the root node perimeter. This ratio provides a measure of the tree's spatial organization.

b2DynamicTree_GetAreaRatio(tree: b2DynamicTree): number
Parameters
tree (b2DynamicTree) The dynamic tree structure to analyze
Returns

Rebuilds a dynamic tree from the bottom up by iteratively combining nodes with the lowest perimeter cost. The function first identifies all leaf nodes, then pairs them based on minimum combined AABB perimeter, creating parent nodes until a single root node remains.

Parameters
tree (b2DynamicTree) The dynamic tree to rebuild
Returns
void:

b2DynamicTree_Query

Queries a dynamic tree to find all nodes that overlap with the given AABB and match the category mask bits. Uses a stack-based traversal to efficiently search the tree structure.

b2DynamicTree_Query(tree: b2DynamicTree, aabb: b2AABB, maskBits: number, callback: function, context: any): void
Parameters
tree (b2DynamicTree) The dynamic tree to query
aabb (b2AABB) The axis-aligned bounding box to test for overlaps
maskBits (number) Category bits used to filter nodes
callback (function) Function called for each overlapping leaf node. Return false to terminate early, true to continue.
context (any) User context data passed to the callback function
Returns
void:

b2DynamicTree_RayCast

Traverses the dynamic tree and finds all leaf nodes that intersect with the input ray. For each intersection, calls the callback function which can control continuation of the search. Uses an AABB overlap test and separating axis test to efficiently cull branches.

b2DynamicTree_RayCast(tree: b2DynamicTree, input: b2RayCastInput, maskBits: number, callback: Function, context: any)
Parameters
tree (b2DynamicTree) The dynamic tree to query
input (b2RayCastInput) Input parameters for the ray cast including:
  • origin: b2Vec2 starting point
  • translation: b2Vec2 ray direction and length
  • maxFraction: number maximum ray length multiplier
maskBits (number) Bit mask to filter nodes by category
callback (Function) Function called for each leaf node intersection
  • Parameters: (input: b2RayCastInput, nodeId: number, userData: any, context: any)
  • Returns: number between 0 and 1 to continue search, 0 to terminate
context (any) User context passed to callback

b2DynamicTree_ShapeCast

Performs a shape cast query against nodes in a dynamic tree, testing for overlaps between a moving shape and static shapes in the tree.

b2DynamicTree_ShapeCast(tree: b2DynamicTree, input: b2ShapeCastInput, maskBits: number, callback: Function, context: any): void
Parameters
tree (b2DynamicTree) The dynamic tree to query against
input (b2ShapeCastInput) Contains the shape definition, translation vector, radius, and maximum fraction for the cast
maskBits (number) Bit mask to filter tree nodes by category
callback (Function) Function called when potential overlaps are found. Returns a fraction value to continue or terminate the cast
context (any) User data passed to the callback function
Returns
void: The callback function should have the signature: function(input: b2ShapeCastInput, nodeId: number, userData: any, context: any): number It should return 0 to terminate the cast, or a fraction between 0 and 1 to update the cast distance

b2DynamicTree_Rebuild

Rebuilds a dynamic tree by collecting all leaf nodes and reconstructing the tree structure. The function deallocates internal nodes during traversal and builds a new balanced tree from the collected leaf nodes.

b2DynamicTree_Rebuild(tree: b2DynamicTree): number
Parameters
tree (b2DynamicTree) The dynamic tree to rebuild
Returns
number: The number of leaf nodes in the rebuilt tree

b2IsValidRay

  • The translation vector is valid

  • The maxFraction is between 0 and B2_HUGE(exclusive)

  • origin: b2Vec2 - Starting point of the ray
  • translation: b2Vec2 - Direction and length of the ray
  • maxFraction: number - Maximum fraction of translation to check
Returns
boolean: True if the ray cast input is valid, false otherwise.

b2MakePolygon

Creates a b2Polygon from a convex hull. If the hull has fewer than 3 points, returns a square shape. The function computes the polygon's vertices, edge normals, and centroid. Each edge normal is a unit vector perpendicular to the corresponding edge.

b2MakePolygon(hull: b2Hull, radius: number, forceCheck: boolean): b2Polygon
Parameters
hull (b2Hull) A convex hull structure containing points that define the polygon vertices
radius (number) The radius used to round the corners of the polygon
forceCheck (boolean = true) Whether to enforce hull validation
Returns
b2Polygon: A new polygon shape with computed vertices, normals, and centroid
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the hull is invalid

b2MakeOffsetPolygon

Creates a polygon shape from a hull with specified radius and transform

b2MakeOffsetPolygon(hull: b2Hull, radius: number, transform: b2Transform, forceCheck: boolean): b2Polygon
Parameters
hull (b2Hull) The input hull to create the polygon from
radius (number) The radius to offset the polygon vertices
transform (b2Transform) Transform to apply to the hull points
forceCheck (boolean = true) Whether to force validation check of the hull
Returns
b2Polygon: A new polygon shape with transformed vertices, computed normals and centroid
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion error if hull validation fails

b2MakeSquare(h: number): b2Polygon
Parameters
h (number) The half-width and half-height of the square.
Returns

b2MakeBox

b2MakeBox

Creates a rectangular polygon shape centered at the origin with specified half-widths. The vertices are arranged counter-clockwise starting from the bottom-left corner. The shape includes pre-computed normals for each edge.

b2MakeBox(hx: number, hy: number): b2Polygon
Parameters
hx (number) Half-width of the box in the x-direction (must be positive)
hy (number) Half-height of the box in the y-direction (must be positive)
Returns
b2Polygon: A polygon shape representing a rectangle with:
  • 4 vertices at (-hx,-hy), (hx,-hy), (hx,hy), (-hx,hy)
  • 4 normals pointing outward from each edge
  • radius of 0
  • centroid at (0,0)
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if hx or hy are not valid positive numbers

b2MakeRoundedBox

Creates a rounded box shape by generating a box with specified dimensions and corner radius.

b2MakeRoundedBox(hx: number, hy: number, radius: number): b2Polygon
Parameters
hx (number) Half-width of the box along the x-axis
hy (number) Half-height of the box along the y-axis
radius (number) Radius of the rounded corners
Returns
b2Polygon: A polygon shape representing a rounded box

b2MakeOffsetBox

Creates a b2Polygon representing a rectangle with the given dimensions. The box is centered at the specified position and rotated by the given angle. The resulting polygon includes 4 vertices, 4 normals, and has its centroid set to the center position.

b2MakeOffsetBox(hx: number, hy: number, center: b2Vec2, angle: number): b2Polygon
Parameters
hx (number) Half-width of the box along the x-axis
hy (number) Half-height of the box along the y-axis
center (b2Vec2) The center position of the box
angle (number) The rotation angle of the box in radians
Returns
b2Polygon: A polygon shape representing the box with 4 vertices and normals

b2TransformPolygon

Applies a rigid body transformation to a polygon by:

  1. Transforming each vertex using the full transform
  2. Rotating each normal vector using only the rotation component
  3. Transforming the centroid using the full transform
b2TransformPolygon(transform: b2Transform, polygon: b2Polygon): b2Polygon
Parameters
transform (b2Transform) The transformation to apply, consisting of a position vector and rotation.
polygon (b2Polygon) The polygon to transform, containing vertices, normals and centroid.
Returns
b2Polygon: The transformed polygon with updated vertices, normals and centroid.

b2ComputeCircleMass

Calculates the mass, center of mass, and rotational inertia for a circle shape with given density. The rotational inertia is computed about the center of mass using the parallel axis theorem when the circle's center is offset from the origin.

b2ComputeCircleMass(shape: b2Circle, density: number): b2MassData
Parameters
shape (b2Circle) A circle shape object containing radius and center properties
density (number) The density of the circle in mass per unit area
Returns
b2MassData: An object containing:
  • mass: The total mass of the circle
  • center: The center of mass (copied from shape.center)
  • rotationalInertia: The rotational inertia about the center of mass

b2ComputeCapsuleMass

Computes mass properties for a capsule shape, including total mass, center of mass, and rotational inertia. A capsule consists of a rectangle with semicircles at both ends.

b2ComputeCapsuleMass(shape: b2Capsule, density: number): b2MassData
Parameters
shape (b2Capsule) A capsule shape defined by two centers (center1, center2) and a radius
density (number) The density of the capsule in mass per unit area
Returns
b2MassData: An object containing:
  • mass: The total mass of the capsule
  • center: A b2Vec2 representing the center of mass
  • rotationalInertia: The moment of inertia about the center of mass

b2ComputePolygonMass

Computes mass properties for a polygon shape, including mass, center of mass, and rotational inertia. Handles special cases for 1-vertex (circle) and 2-vertex (capsule) polygons. For polygons with 3 or more vertices, calculates properties using triangulation.

b2ComputePolygonMass(shape: b2Polygon, density: number): b2MassData
Parameters
shape (b2Polygon) The polygon shape containing vertices, normals, count, and radius
density (number) The density of the shape in mass per unit area
Returns
b2MassData: Object containing:
  • mass: Total mass of the shape
  • center: Center of mass as b2Vec2
  • rotationalInertia: Moment of inertia about the center of mass
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion error if shape.count is 0 or exceeds B2_MAX_POLYGON_VERTICES

b2ComputeCircleAABB

Calculates the AABB by transforming the circle's center point using the provided transform and extending the bounds by the circle's radius in each direction.

b2ComputeCircleAABB(shape: b2Circle, xf2: b2Transform): b2AABB
Parameters
shape (b2Circle) The circle shape containing center point and radius.
xf2 (b2Transform) The transform to be applied, consisting of a position (p) and rotation (q).
Returns
b2AABB: An AABB object defined by minimum and maximum points that bound the transformed circle.

b2ComputeCapsuleAABB

Calculates the minimum and maximum bounds of a capsule after applying a transform. The AABB is computed by transforming the capsule's center points and extending the bounds by the capsule's radius in all directions.

b2ComputeCapsuleAABB(shape: b2Capsule, xf2: b2Transform): b2AABB
Parameters
shape (b2Capsule) A capsule shape defined by two centers and a radius.
xf2 (b2Transform) A transform containing position and rotation to be applied to the capsule.
Returns
b2AABB: An AABB that encompasses the transformed capsule shape.

b2ComputePolygonAABB

Computes the Axis-Aligned Bounding Box (AABB) for a polygon shape after applying a transform. The AABB includes the polygon's radius in its calculations.

b2ComputePolygonAABB(shape: b2Polygon, xf2: b2Transform): b2AABB
Parameters
shape (b2Polygon) The polygon shape containing vertices and radius
xf2 (b2Transform) The transform to apply, consisting of position (p) and rotation (q)
Returns
b2AABB: An AABB object with lower and upper bounds that encompass the transformed polygon

b2ComputeSegmentAABB

Transforms the segment's endpoints using the provided transform, then creates an AABB that encompasses the transformed segment by finding the minimum and maximum coordinates of the transformed endpoints.

b2ComputeSegmentAABB(shape: b2Segment, xf2: b2Transform): b2AABB
Parameters
shape (b2Segment) A line segment defined by two points (point1 and point2)
xf2 (b2Transform) A transform containing position and rotation to be applied to the segment
Returns
b2AABB: An AABB that contains the transformed line segment

b2PointInCircle

Tests if a point lies within a circle by comparing the squared distance between the point and circle's center against the circle's squared radius.

b2PointInCircle(point: b2Vec2, shape: b2Circle): boolean
Parameters
point (b2Vec2) The point to test, represented as a 2D vector.
shape (b2Circle) The circle to test against, containing center and radius properties.
Returns
boolean: True if the point lies within or on the circle's boundary, false otherwise.

b2PointInCapsule

A capsule is defined by two end centers (center1 and center2) and a radius. The function calculates if the given point lies within the capsule by:

  1. Testing if the capsule has zero length (centers are identical)
  2. If not, finding the closest point on the line segment between centers
  3. Checking if the distance from the test point to the closest point is within the radius
b2PointInCapsule(point: b2Vec2, shape: b2Capsule): boolean
Parameters
point (b2Vec2) The point to test
shape (b2Capsule) The capsule shape defined by two centers and a radius
Returns
boolean: True if the point lies inside or on the capsule, false otherwise

b2PointInPolygon

Tests if a point lies inside a polygon shape by calculating the minimum distance between the point and the polygon.

b2PointInPolygon(point: b2Vec2, shape: b2Polygon): boolean
Parameters
point (b2Vec2) The point to test
shape (b2Polygon) The polygon shape to test against
Returns
boolean: True if the point is inside or on the polygon (within shape.radius), false otherwise

b2RayCastCircle

Calculates the intersection point between a ray and a circle shape. Returns early with no hit if the ray length is 0 or if the ray passes outside the circle radius.

b2RayCastCircle(input: b2RayCastInput, shape: b2Circle): b2CastOutput
Parameters
input (b2RayCastInput) The ray cast input parameters containing:
  • origin: b2Vec2 starting point of the ray
  • translation: b2Vec2 direction and length of the ray
  • maxFraction: number maximum intersection distance as a fraction of ray length
shape (b2Circle) The circle shape to test against, containing:
  • center: b2Vec2 position of circle center
  • radius: number radius of the circle
Returns
b2CastOutput: The ray cast results containing:
  • hit: boolean whether the ray intersects the circle
  • point: b2Vec2 point of intersection if hit is true
  • normal: b2Vec2 surface normal at intersection point if hit is true
  • fraction: number intersection distance as a fraction of ray length if hit is true

b2RayCastCapsule

Performs a ray cast against a capsule shape. A capsule is defined by two centers and a radius. If the capsule length is near zero, it degrades to a circle ray cast.

b2RayCastCapsule(input: b2RayCastInput, shape: b2Capsule): b2CastOutput
Parameters
input (b2RayCastInput) Contains ray cast parameters including:
  • origin: b2Vec2 starting point of the ray
  • translation: b2Vec2 direction and length of the ray
  • maxFraction: number maximum intersection distance as a fraction of ray length
shape (b2Capsule) The capsule to test against, containing:
  • center1: b2Vec2 first endpoint of capsule centerline
  • center2: b2Vec2 second endpoint of capsule centerline
  • radius: number radius of the capsule
Returns
b2CastOutput: Contains the ray cast results:
  • fraction: number intersection distance as a fraction of ray length
  • point: b2Vec2 point of intersection
  • normal: b2Vec2 surface normal at intersection
  • hit: boolean whether an intersection occurred

b2RayCastSegment

Performs a ray cast against a line segment, determining if and where the ray intersects the segment. For one-sided segments, intersections are only detected from one side based on a cross product test.

b2RayCastSegment(input: b2RayCastInput, shape: b2Segment, oneSided: boolean): b2CastOutput
Parameters
input (b2RayCastInput) Contains origin point, translation vector, and max fraction for the ray
shape (b2Segment) The line segment defined by two points (point1 and point2)
oneSided (boolean) Whether to treat the segment as one-sided
Returns
b2CastOutput: Contains hit status, intersection point, normal, and fraction along the ray

b2RayCastPolygon

Performs a ray cast against a polygon shape, detecting intersection points and normals. For non-zero radius polygons, converts the ray cast into a shape cast operation.

b2RayCastPolygon(input: b2RayCastInput, shape: b2Polygon): b2CastOutput
Parameters
input (b2RayCastInput) Contains origin point, translation vector, and max fraction
shape (b2Polygon) The polygon to test against, containing vertices, normals, count and radius
Returns
b2CastOutput: Contains:
  • hit: boolean indicating if intersection occurred
  • point: intersection point (if hit is true)
  • normal: surface normal at intersection (if hit is true)
  • fraction: fraction of translation where intersection occurred (if hit is true)
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion error if input ray is invalid

b2ShapeCastCircle

Performs shape casting between a circle and a set of points with radius.

b2ShapeCastCircle(input: b2ShapeCastInput, shape: b2Circle): b2CastOutput

shape (b2Circle) Circle shape with center point and radius
Returns
b2CastOutput: The shape cast result containing intersection details

shape (b2Capsule) The capsule shape defined by two centers and a radius
Returns
b2CastOutput: The result of the shape cast operation

b2ShapeCastSegment

Performs a shape cast operation between a segment and another shape. The function creates proxies for both shapes, sets up their initial transforms, and performs the cast operation using the specified translation and maximum fraction.

b2ShapeCastSegment(input: b2ShapeCastInput, shape: b2Segment): b2CastOutput

Hull

Hull

Hull

b2ComputeHull

Computes the convex hull of a set of 2D points. The function:

  • Filters duplicate points within a tolerance
  • Finds extreme points to establish initial hull edges
  • Recursively adds points to build the complete hull
  • Removes collinear/near-collinear points from final hull
b2ComputeHull(points: Array<b2Vec2>, count: number): b2Hull
Parameters
points (Array<b2Vec2>) Array of 2D points to compute hull from
count (number) Number of points in the array
Returns
b2Hull: A hull object containing the computed convex hull vertices
Throws
  • Error: If count < 3 or count > B2_MAX_POLYGON_VERTICES

b2ComputeHull

This file includes code that is:

  • Copyright 2023 Erin Catto, released under the MIT license.
  • Copyright 2024 Phaser Studio Inc, released under the MIT license.
b2ComputeHull

b2ValidateHull

Validates that a hull meets the requirements for a valid convex polygon:

  • Has between 3 and B2_MAX_POLYGON_VERTICES points
  • Points are in counter-clockwise order
  • All points are behind the edges
  • No collinear points within b2_linearSlop tolerance
b2ValidateHull(hull: b2Hull): boolean
Parameters
hull (b2Hull) The hull to validate, containing points array and count
Returns
boolean: True if the hull is valid, false otherwise
Throws
  • Warning: Console warnings are issued explaining validation failures

b2DefaultDistanceJointDef

Creates and returns a new b2DistanceJointDef object initialized with specific default values. The length is set to 1 unit and the maxLength is set to B2_HUGE. All other properties of the joint definition retain their default values from the b2DistanceJointDef constructor.

Returns
b2DistanceJointDef: A distance joint definition with:
  • length set to 1
  • maxLength set to B2_HUGE
  • all other properties at their default values

b2DefaultMotorJointDef(): b2MotorJointDef
Returns
b2MotorJointDef: A motor joint definition with:
  • maxForce: 1
  • maxTorque: 1
  • correctionFactor: 0.3
  • linearOffset: (0,0)
  • angularOffset: 0

  • dampingRatio = 1
  • maxForce = 1

  • damping: 0

b2DefaultWheelJointDef

Creates and returns a new b2WheelJointDef with common default values. The joint's local axis is set to point upward, and spring behavior is enabled with standard frequency and damping values.

b2CreateDistanceJoint

b2CreateDistanceJoint(worldId: b2WorldId, def: b2DistanceJointDef): b2JointId
Parameters
worldId (b2WorldId) The ID of the Box2D world
def (b2DistanceJointDef) The joint definition containing:
  • bodyIdA: ID of the first body
  • bodyIdB: ID of the second body
  • localAnchorA: Local anchor point on body A
  • localAnchorB: Local anchor point on body B
  • length: Desired distance between anchor points
  • minLength: Minimum allowed distance
  • maxLength: Maximum allowed distance
  • hertz: Spring frequency in Hz
  • dampingRatio: Spring damping ratio
  • maxMotorForce: Maximum motor force
  • motorSpeed: Motor speed
  • enableSpring: Enable/disable spring
  • enableLimit: Enable/disable length limits
  • enableMotor: Enable/disable motor
  • collideConnected: Allow collision between connected bodies
  • userData: User data
Returns
b2JointId: The ID of the created distance joint
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion error if world is locked, bodies are invalid, or length <= 0

Returns

b2CollideCapsules

Computes the collision manifold between two capsule shapes in 2D space. A capsule is defined by two endpoints and a radius.

b2CollideCapsules(capsuleA: b2Capsule, xfA: b2Transform, capsuleB: b2Capsule, xfB: b2Transform, manifold: b2Manifold): void
Parameters
capsuleA (b2Capsule) The first capsule shape
xfA (b2Transform) Transform for the first capsule
capsuleB (b2Capsule) The second capsule shape
xfB (b2Transform) Transform for the second capsule
manifold (b2Manifold) Output collision manifold
Returns
void: Modifies the manifold parameter with collision data:
  • normalX/Y: Collision normal vector
  • pointCount: Number of contact points (0-2)
  • points[]: Contact point data including:
  • anchorA/B: Contact points in local coordinates
  • separation: Penetration depth
  • id: Contact ID

b2CollideChainSegmentAndPolygon

Computes the collision manifold between a chain segment (a segment with rounded corners) and a polygon. The function handles edge cases including convex/concave corners and determines contact points and normals. The manifold is populated with contact points and can contain 0, 1 or 2 contact points depending on the collision configuration.

b2ComputeAngularVelocity

Calculates the angular velocity by comparing two rotations and dividing by the time step. Uses the formula (2 - 1)/dt where is extracted from the rotations using their sine and cosine components.

b2MulRot

Performs rotation multiplication by combining the cosine and sine components of two b2Rot objects using the formula: result.c = q4.c * r.c - q4.s * r.s result.s = q4.s * r.c + q4.c * r.s

b2MulRot(q: b2Rot, r: b2Rot): b2Rot
Parameters
q (b2Rot) First rotation
r (b2Rot) Second rotation
Returns
b2Rot: A new rotation representing the product of the two input rotations

b2InvMulRot

Computes the product of the inverse of rotation q with rotation r. For rotations, the inverse multiplication is equivalent to using the transpose of the rotation matrix.

b2InvMulRot(q: b2Rot, r: b2Rot): b2Rot
Parameters
q (b2Rot) The first rotation to be inverted
r (b2Rot) The second rotation to be multiplied
Returns
b2Rot: A new rotation representing q^-1 * r

a (b2Rot) The second rotation

number: The relative angle in radians between the two rotations

This function takes an angle in radians and ensures it falls within the range [-, ] by adding or subtracting 2 as needed. If the input angle is already within the valid range, it is returned unchanged.

b2UnwindAngle(angle: number): number
Parameters

Returns
number: The normalized angle in radians within the range [-, ].

b2Vec2: A new vector representing the inverse rotation of v by q4

b2TransformPoint

Applies a rigid body transformation to a 2D point. The transformation consists of a rotation followed by a translation. The rotation is applied using the rotation matrix stored in t.q (cosine and sine components), and the translation is applied using the position vector stored in t.p.

b2TransformPoint(t: b2Transform, p: b2Vec2): b2Vec2
Parameters
t (b2Transform) A transform containing position (p) and rotation (q) components
p (b2Vec2) The point to transform
Returns
b2Vec2: The transformed point

b2InvTransformPoint

Computes the inverse transform of a point by first translating relative to the transform's position, then applying the inverse rotation. The rotation inverse is computed using the transpose of the rotation matrix.

b2InvTransformPoint(t: b2Transform, p: b2Vec2): b2Vec2
Parameters
t (b2Transform) A transform containing position (p) and rotation (q) components
p (b2Vec2) The point to transform
Returns
b2Vec2: The inverse transformed point

b2MulTransforms

Combines two transforms by first multiplying their rotations (q components), then rotating B's position vector by A's rotation and adding it to A's position. The result represents the combined transformation of first applying B, then A.

b2MulTransforms(A: b2Transform, B: b2Transform): b2Transform
Parameters
A (b2Transform) The first transform
B (b2Transform) The second transform
Returns
b2Transform: A new transform C that represents the multiplication of A and B

b2InvMulTransforms

Calculates A^-1 * B, where A^-1 is the inverse of transform A. The result combines both the rotational and translational components of the transforms using their quaternion and position vectors.

b2InvMulTransforms(A: b2Transform, B: b2Transform): b2Transform
Parameters
A (b2Transform) The first transform
B (b2Transform) The second transform
Returns
b2Transform: A new transform representing the inverse multiplication of A and B

b2MulMV

Performs matrix-vector multiplication of the form Av, where A is a 2x2 matrix and v is a 2D vector. The result is a new 2D vector.

b2MulMV(A: b2Mat22, v: b2Vec2): b2Vec2
Parameters
A (b2Mat22) A 2x2 matrix with components cx and cy, each containing x and y values
v (b2Vec2) A 2D vector with x and y components
Returns
b2Vec2: The resulting 2D vector from the matrix-vector multiplication

b2GetInverse22

Computes the inverse of a 2x2 matrix using the formula: For matrix [[a,b],[c,d]], inverse = (1/det) * [[d,-c],[-b,a]] where det = ad-bc

b2GetInverse22(A: b2Mat22): b2Mat22
Parameters
A (b2Mat22) The input 2x2 matrix to invert
Returns
b2Mat22: The inverse of matrix A. If the determinant is 0, returns a matrix with undefined values

b2Solve22

Solves the system using the formula: x = (1/det) * [a22 -a12] * [b.x] [-a21 a11] [b.y] where det = a11a22 - a12a21

b2Solve22(A: b2Mat22, b: b2Vec2): b2Vec2
Parameters
A (b2Mat22) A 2x2 matrix represented as two column vectors (cx, cy)
b (b2Vec2) A 2D vector representing the right-hand side of the equation
Returns
b2Vec2: The solution vector x that satisfies Ax = b. Returns a zero vector if the system is singular (det = 0)

b2AABB_Contains

Tests if AABB 'b' is completely contained within AABB 'a' by comparing their bounds. An AABB contains another if its lower bounds are less than or equal to the other's lower bounds and its upper bounds are greater than or equal to the other's upper bounds.

b2AABB_Contains(a: b2AABB, b: b2AABB): boolean
Parameters
a (b2AABB) The containing AABB
b (b2AABB) The AABB to test for containment
Returns
boolean: True if AABB 'a' completely contains AABB 'b', false otherwise

Returns

b2AABB_Union(a: b2AABB, b: b2AABB): b2AABB

b2Normalize

Normalizes the input vector by dividing its components by its length. If the vector's length is greater than the epsilon value, the function returns a new vector with the same direction but unit length.

b2Normalize(v: b2Vec2): b2Vec2
Parameters
v (b2Vec2) The vector to normalize.
Returns
b2Vec2: Returns a new normalized b2Vec2 if successful. If the vector length is less than epsilon, returns a zero vector (0,0).

b2CreateCircleShape

Creates a circle shape and attaches it to a body.

b2CreateCircleShape(bodyId: b2BodyId, def: b2ShapeDef, circle: b2Circle): b2ShapeId
Parameters

circle (b2Circle) The circle geometry definition
Returns
b2ShapeId: The identifier of the created circle shape

b2CreateCapsuleShape

Creates a capsule shape if the distance between centers is greater than b2_linearSlop. If centers are closer than b2_linearSlop, creates a circle shape instead with radius equal to the capsule radius and center at the midpoint between capsule centers.

b2CreateCapsuleShape(bodyId: b2BodyId, def: b2ShapeDef, capsule: b2Capsule): b2ShapeId
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The body ID to attach the shape to
def (b2ShapeDef) The shape definition parameters
capsule (b2Capsule) The capsule geometry containing center1, center2 and radius
Returns
b2ShapeId: The ID of the created shape

b2CreatePolygonShape

Creates a polygon shape and attaches it to a body.

b2CreatePolygonShape(bodyId: b2BodyId, def: b2ShapeDef, polygon: b2Polygon): b2ShapeId
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The identifier of the body to attach the shape to
def (b2ShapeDef) The shape definition containing common shape properties
polygon (b2Polygon) The polygon data including vertices and radius
Returns
b2ShapeId: The identifier of the created polygon shape
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the polygon radius is invalid or negative

b2CreateSegmentShape

Creates a segment shape between two points and attaches it to the specified body. The function validates that the segment length is greater than b2_linearSlop before creating the shape.

b2CreateSegmentShape(bodyId: b2BodyId, def: b2ShapeDef, segment: b2Segment): b2ShapeId
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The ID of the body to attach the shape to
def (b2ShapeDef) The shape definition parameters
segment (b2Segment) The segment geometry defined by point1 and point2
Returns
b2ShapeId: The ID of the created segment shape
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the segment length squared is less than or equal to b2_linearSlop squared

b2DestroyShape

Removes a shape from the physics world. If the parent body has automatic mass calculation enabled, the body's mass properties are recalculated after the shape is destroyed. The function performs the following operations:

  1. Retrieves the world and shape from the provided shapeId
  2. Destroys the shape internally
  3. Updates the parent body's mass data if automatic mass calculation is enabled
b2DestroyShape(shapeId: b2ShapeId)
Parameters
shapeId (b2ShapeId) The identifier of the shape to destroy.

b2CreateChain

Creates a chain shape composed of connected line segments attached to a body. The chain can be either a closed loop or an open chain.

b2CreateChain(bodyId: b2BodyId, def: b2ChainDef): b2ChainId
Parameters
bodyId (b2BodyId) The ID of the body to attach the chain to
def (b2ChainDef) The chain definition containing:
  • {number} count - Number of vertices (must be >= 4)
  • {b2Vec2[]} points - Array of vertex points
  • {boolean} isLoop - Whether the chain forms a closed loop
  • {number} friction - Friction coefficient (must be >= 0)
  • {number} restitution - Restitution coefficient (must be >= 0)
  • {b2Filter} filter - Collision filter data
  • {*} userData - User data pointer
Returns
b2ChainId: The ID of the created chain shape
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion error if friction or restitution are invalid/negative, or if count is less than 4

b2DestroyChain

Destroys a chain of shapes attached to a body in a Box2D world. The function removes all shapes associated with the chain and frees the chain ID from the world's chain ID pool.

b2DestroyChain(chainId: b2ChainId): void
Parameters
chainId (b2ChainId) The identifier for the chain to be destroyed, containing world and index information
Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the chain is not found in the body's chain list

Parameters

b2Shape_RayCast

Performs a ray cast against a shape in world space, transforming the input/output between local and world coordinates.

b2Shape_RayCast(shapeId: b2ShapeId, origin: b2Vec2, translation: b2Vec2): b2CastOutput
Parameters
shapeId (b2ShapeId) The identifier for the shape to test
origin (b2Vec2) The starting point of the ray in world coordinates
translation (b2Vec2) The direction and length of the ray in world coordinates
Returns
b2CastOutput: The ray cast results containing:
  • hit: boolean indicating if the ray intersects the shape
  • point: intersection point in world coordinates (if hit is true)
  • normal: surface normal at intersection in world coordinates (if hit is true)
  • fraction: fraction of translation where intersection occurs (if hit is true)
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion error if shape type is invalid

Types

Types

Types

b2DefaultWorldDef

Initializes a new b2WorldDef with default values suitable for standard physics simulations. All distance-based values are scaled by b2_lengthUnitsPerMeter2.

b2DefaultWorldDef(): b2WorldDef
Returns
b2WorldDef: A world definition object with the following properties:
  • gravity: {b2Vec2} Set to (0, -10)
  • hitEventThreshold: {number} Set to 1 meter
  • restitutionThreshold: {number} Set to 10 meters
  • contactPushoutVelocity: {number} Set to 5 meters
  • contactHertz: {number} Set to 30
  • contactDampingRatio: {number} Set to 10
  • jointHertz: {number} Set to 60
  • jointDampingRatio: {number} Set to 5
  • maximumLinearVelocity: {number} Set to 400 meters
  • enableSleep: {boolean} Set to true
  • enableContinuous: {boolean} Set to true

b2DefaultBodyDef

Creates a new b2BodyDef with default values.

b2DefaultBodyDef(): b2BodyDef
Returns
b2BodyDef: A body definition object with the following default properties:
  • type: b2_staticBody
  • position: (0,0)
  • rotation: (cos=1, sin=0)
  • linearVelocity: (0,0)
  • angularVelocity: 0
  • linearDamping: 0
  • angularDamping: 0
  • gravityScale: 1
  • sleepThreshold: 0.05 * b2_lengthUnitsPerMeter2
  • userData: null
  • enableSleep: true
  • isAwake: true
  • fixedRotation: false
  • isBullet: false
  • isEnabled: true
  • updateBodyMass: true
  • allowFastRotation: false

b2DefaultFilter

Creates and returns a new b2Filter object initialized with default values for collision filtering. The categoryBits determine what collision category this object belongs to, the maskBits determine what categories this object can collide with, and the groupIndex determines collision groups (negative values mean never collide, positive values mean always collide with same group).

b2DefaultFilter(): b2Filter
Returns
b2Filter: A filter object with categoryBits=1, maskBits=4294967295 (0xFFFFFFFF), and groupIndex=0

b2DefaultQueryFilter

This function instantiates a new b2QueryFilter with default collision filtering settings. The categoryBits value of 1 represents the default category, while the maskBits value of 4294967295 allows collision with all categories.

b2DefaultQueryFilter(): b2QueryFilter
Returns
b2QueryFilter: A query filter object with categoryBits set to 1 and maskBits set to 4294967295 (0xFFFFFFFF).

b2DefaultShapeDef

This function initializes a new b2ShapeDef object with commonly used physics properties. The shape definition can be used to create various types of physics shapes in Box2D.

b2DefaultShapeDef(): b2ShapeDef
Returns
b2ShapeDef: A shape definition object with the following default values:
  • friction: 0.6
  • density: 1
  • restitution: 0.1
  • filter: default collision filter
  • enableSensorEvents: true
  • enableContactEvents: true

b2DefaultChainDef

b2DistanceJointDef

This requires defining an anchor point on both bodies and the non-zero distance of the distance joint. The definition uses local anchor points so that the initial configuration can violate the constraint slightly. This helps when saving and loading a game.

b2CreateWorldArray

Initializes a global array of Box2D world instances if it hasn't been created yet. Creates B2_MAX_WORLDS number of world instances and marks them as not in use. If the array already exists, the function returns without doing anything.

b2CreateWorldArray(): void
Returns
void:
Related
b2World

b2CreateWorld

Creates and initializes a new Box2D physics world with the specified parameters. The function allocates memory for physics entities (bodies, joints, contacts), initializes contact registers, creates necessary pools and arrays, and sets up the world properties according to the provided definition.

b2CreateWorld(def: b2WorldDef): b2WorldId
Parameters
def (b2WorldDef) World definition object containing initialization parameters including: gravity, hitEventThreshold, restitutionThreshold, maximumLinearVelocity, contactPushoutVelocity, contactHertz, contactDampingRatio, jointHertz, jointDampingRatio, enableSleep, enableContinuous
Returns
b2WorldId: A world identifier object containing:
  • index: number (worldId + 1)
  • revision: number (world revision number)
Throws
  • Error: Returns a null world ID (0,0) if no world slots are available

b2DestroyWorld

Destroys a Box2D world instance and all its associated resources, including debug sets, task contexts, event arrays, chains, bodies, shapes, contacts, joints, islands, solver sets, constraint graph, broad phase, ID pools, and stack allocator. Creates a new empty world instance with an incremented revision number.

b2DestroyWorld(worldId: b2WorldId): void
Parameters
worldId (b2WorldId) The ID of the world to destroy
Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if a null chain has non-null shape indices

b2World_Step

Performs one step of physics simulation by updating broad phase pairs, handling collisions, and solving the physics constraints. The function manages contact events, sensor events, and body movement events during the simulation step. It also handles warm starting and enforces velocity limits based on world settings.

b2World_Step(worldId: b2WorldId, timeStep: number, subStepCount: number): void
Parameters
worldId (b2WorldId) The identifier of the physics world to step
timeStep (number) The time increment to advance the simulation (in seconds)
subStepCount (number) The number of sub-steps to use for the iteration
Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the world's stack allocator is not empty after the step completes.

worldId (b2WorldId) ID of the Box2D world to render
draw (b2DebugDraw) Debug drawing context with rendering flags and methods
Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws assertion error if world is locked or body transform is null

b2World_GetBodyEvents

Retrieves the body movement events from a Box2D world. Returns an empty events object if the world is locked. The function copies the world's body move event array and count into a new b2BodyEvents object.

b2World_GetBodyEvents(worldId: b2WorldId): b2BodyEvents
Parameters
worldId (b2WorldId) The identifier for the Box2D world instance
Returns
b2BodyEvents: An object containing an array of body move events and their count
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the world is locked

b2World_GetSensorEvents

Retrieves the sensor events from a Box2D world. The function returns both begin and end sensor events that occurred during the simulation step. If the world is locked, it returns an empty events object.

b2World_GetSensorEvents(worldId: b2WorldId): b2SensorEvents
Parameters

Returns

b2World_GetContactEvents

Returns a b2ContactEvents object containing three arrays: contactBeginArray, contactEndArray, and contactHitArray, representing different types of contact events that occurred in the physics simulation. The object also includes count values for each type of event.

b2World_GetContactEvents(worldId: b2WorldId): b2ContactEvents
Parameters

Throws

b2World_IsValid

Checks if a world ID is valid by verifying:

  1. The ID is not undefined
  2. The index is within valid bounds (1 to B2_MAX_WORLDS)
  3. The world exists at the specified index
  4. The revision number matches the world's current revision
b2World_IsValid(id: b2WorldId): boolean
Parameters
id (b2WorldId) The world identifier to validate, containing index1 and revision properties
Returns
boolean: True if the world ID is valid and matches the stored world revision, false otherwise

b2Body_IsValid

Performs validation checks on a body ID including:

  • Verifies the ID is defined and is a b2BodyId instance
  • Checks the world index is within valid bounds
  • Confirms the world exists and matches the ID
  • Validates the body index exists in the world
  • Ensures the body is active and the revision number matches
b2Body_IsValid(id: b2BodyId): boolean
Parameters
id (b2BodyId) The body ID to validate
Returns
boolean: True if the ID is valid and references an existing body, false otherwise

b2Shape_IsValid

Checks if a shape ID is valid by verifying:

  • The ID exists and is not undefined
  • The world index is within bounds
  • The referenced world exists and matches the world ID
  • The shape index is within bounds of the world's shape array
  • The shape exists and is not marked as null
  • The shape revision matches the ID's revision
b2Shape_IsValid(id: b2ShapeId): boolean
Parameters
id (b2ShapeId) The shape ID to validate, containing world0, index1, and revision properties
Returns
boolean: True if the shape ID is valid and references an existing shape, false otherwise

b2Chain_IsValid

Checks if a chain ID is valid by verifying:

  • The ID exists
  • The world index is within valid bounds
  • The world exists and matches the ID
  • The chain index is within valid bounds
  • The chain exists and is not null
  • The revision number matches
b2Chain_IsValid(id: b2ChainId): boolean
Parameters
id (b2ChainId) The chain identifier containing world0 (world index), index1 (chain index), and revision properties
Returns
boolean: Returns true if the chain ID is valid and matches the current revision, false otherwise

b2Joint_IsValid

Checks if a joint ID is valid by verifying:

  • The world index is within bounds
  • The referenced world exists and matches the ID

  • The revision number matches the joint's revision

b2World_EnableSleeping

Enables or disables the sleep management system for the specified Box2D world. When sleep is disabled, all sleeping bodies are awakened. The function has no effect if the world is locked or if the requested sleep state matches the current state.

Parameters
worldId (b2WorldId) The identifier of the Box2D world.
flag (boolean) When true, enables sleep management. When false, wakes all sleeping bodies.
Returns
void:
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the world is locked.

b2World_OverlapAABB

Performs a broadphase query using the world's dynamic tree to find all fixtures that overlap with the given AABB. For each overlapping fixture that passes the filter, the callback function is invoked.

b2World_OverlapAABB(worldId: b2WorldId, aabb: b2AABB, filter: b2QueryFilter, fcn: b2OverlapResultFcn, context: any)
Parameters
worldId (b2WorldId) The ID of the physics world to query
aabb (b2AABB) The axis-aligned bounding box defining the query region
filter (b2QueryFilter) Filter settings to control which fixtures are included
fcn (b2OverlapResultFcn) Callback function that receives each overlapping fixture
context (any) User context data passed to the callback function
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the world is locked or if the AABB is invalid

b2World_OverlapCircle

Performs broad-phase AABB queries to find potential overlaps between the given circle and all shapes in the world that match the filter criteria. For each potential overlap, the callback function is invoked with the overlap details.

b2World_OverlapCircle(worldId: b2WorldId, circle: b2Circle, transform: b2Transform, filter: b2QueryFilter, fcn: function, context: any)
Parameters
worldId (b2WorldId) The ID of the physics world
circle (b2Circle) The circle shape to test for overlaps
transform (b2Transform) The position and rotation transform of the circle
filter (b2QueryFilter) Filtering options for the overlap test
fcn (function) Callback function that handles overlap results
context (any) User context data passed to the callback function
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the world is locked or if the transform contains invalid values.

b2World_OverlapCapsule

Tests a capsule shape against all shapes in the world that pass the filter criteria. For each potential overlap, calls the provided callback function. Uses a broad phase tree structure to efficiently find potential overlaps.

b2World_OverlapCapsule(worldId: b2WorldId, capsule: b2Capsule, transform: b2Transform, filter: b2QueryFilter, fcn: b2OverlapResultFcn, context: any)
Parameters
worldId (b2WorldId) The ID of the physics world
capsule (b2Capsule) The capsule shape to test for overlaps
transform (b2Transform) The position and rotation of the capsule
filter (b2QueryFilter) Filtering options for the query
fcn (b2OverlapResultFcn) Callback function that handles overlap results
context (any) User context data passed to the callback function
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the world is locked or if the transform contains invalid position/rotation values.

b2World_OverlapPolygon

Performs overlap queries for a polygon shape against all shapes in the physics world that match the provided filter criteria.

b2World_OverlapPolygon(worldId: b2WorldId, polygon: b2Polygon, transform: b2Transform, filter: b2QueryFilter, fcn: b2OverlapResultFcn, context: void)
Parameters

context (void) User data passed to the callback function
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the world is locked or if the transform components are invalid

b2World_CastRayClosest

Casts a ray through the physics world and returns information about the closest intersection. The ray is defined by an origin point and a translation vector. The operation checks all body types in the broad phase using a dynamic tree structure.

b2World_CastRayClosest(worldId: b2WorldId, origin: b2Vec2, translation: b2Vec2, filter: b2QueryFilter): b2RayResult
Parameters

Returns
b2RayResult: Information about the closest intersection found
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the world is locked or if the origin/translation vectors are invalid

b2World_CastCircle

Casts a circle shape through the physics world from its initial position along a translation vector, detecting collisions with other shapes. The cast is performed against all body types in the broad phase, stopping if a collision occurs at fraction 0.

b2World_CastCircle(worldId: b2WorldId, circle: b2Circle, originTransform: b2Transform, translation: b2Vec2, filter: b2QueryFilter, fcn: b2CastResultFcn, context: void)

translation (b2Vec2) The displacement vector for the cast
filter (b2QueryFilter) Filtering options for the cast
fcn (b2CastResultFcn) Callback function to handle cast results
context (void) User data passed to the callback function
Throws
  • Error: Throws an assertion error if the world is locked or if the transform position, rotation, or translation vectors are invalid.

b2World_CastCapsule

magnitude (number) The force magnitude of the explosion
Returns
void:

    • position is invalid
    • radius is invalid or <= 0
    • magnitude is invalid
    • world is locked

anchorB (b2Vec2) : Location of the contact point relative to bodyB's origin in world space. When used internally to the Box2D solver, this is relative to the center of mass.

B2_IS_NULL

Tests if a contact ID represents a null/invalid contact by checking if its index1 property equals 0. In Box2D, an index1 value of 0 indicates a null contact ID.

B2_IS_NULL(id: Object): boolean
Parameters
id (Object) A contact ID object containing index1 property
Returns
boolean: Returns true if the contact ID is null (index1 === 0), false otherwise

B2_IS_NON_NULL

Tests whether a contact ID represents a valid contact by checking if its index1 property is not equal to 0. A zero value for index1 indicates a null contact ID.

B2_IS_NON_NULL(id: Object): boolean
Parameters
id (Object) A contact ID object containing an index1 property.
Returns
boolean: Returns true if the contact ID is non-null (index1 !== 0), false otherwise.

B2_ID_EQUALS

Performs a strict equality comparison between corresponding properties of two ID objects. Checks equality of index1, world0, and revision properties.

B2_ID_EQUALS(id1: Object, id2: Object): boolean
Parameters
id1 (Object) First ID object containing index1, world0, and revision properties.
id2 (Object) Second ID object containing index1, world0, and revision properties.
Returns
boolean: True if all corresponding properties between id1 and id2 are equal, false otherwise.

Broadphase

Broadphase

b2BroadPhase

The broad-phase is used for computing pairs and performing volume queries and ray casts. This broad-phase does not persist pairs. Instead, this reports potentially new pairs. It is up to the client to consume the new pairs and to track subsequent overlap.

new b2BroadPhase()

ChainConfig

ChainConfig

Type: Object

Properties
worldId (b2WorldId) : ID for the world.
groundId (b2BodyId) : ID for the static ground to attach the chain ends to.
type (number?) : Type of the body (static, dynamic, kinematic).
firstLinkPosition (b2Vec2) : Position of the first link.
lastLinkPosition (b2Vec2) : Position of the last link.
chainLinks (number) : Number of links in the chain.
linkLength (number) : Length of each link
density (number?) : Density of the links.
friction (number?) : Friction of the links.
color (any?) : Custom color for the links.
radius (number?) : Radius for the circle 'caps' on each capsule link.
fixEnds (boolean) : Should the ends of the chain be fixed to the groundId object?

BodyCapsule

BodyCapsule

Type: Object

Properties
bodyId (b2BodyId) : ID for the body to attach the capsule to.
shapeId (b2ShapeId) : ID for the shape to attach the capsule to.

CircleConfig

CircleConfig

Type: Object

Properties
worldId (b2WorldId) : ID for the world in which to create the circle.
bodyDef (b2BodyDef?) : Body definition for the circle.
type (number?) : Type of the body (static, dynamic, kinematic).
position (b2Vec2?) : Position of the circle's center.
bodyId (b2BodyId?) : Existing body ID if adding as a fixture.
shapeDef (b2ShapeDef?) : Shape definition for the circle.
groupIndex (number?) : Collision filtering, group index for the circle.
categoryBits (number?) : Collision filtering, what 'category' is this cirle in?
maskBits (number?) : Collision filtering, what 'categories' will this circle collide with?
density (number?) : Density of the circle.
friction (number?) : Friction of the circle.
restitution (number?) : Restitution of the circle.
color (any?) : Custom color for the circle.
radius (number?) : Radius of the circle.
preSolve (boolean?) : Enable presolve callback for the circle.
isSensor (boolean?) : A sensor shape generates overlap events but never generates a collision response
offset (b2Vec2?) : Offset of the circle's center when adding as a fixture.

CapsuleConfig

CapsuleConfig

Type: Object

Properties
worldId (b2WorldId) : ID for the world in which to create the capsule.
bodyDef (b2BodyDef?) : Body definition for the capsule.
type (number?) : Type of the body (static, dynamic, kinematic).
position (b2Vec2?) : Position of the capsule's center.
bodyId (b2BodyId?) : Existing body ID if adding as a fixture.
shapeDef (b2ShapeDef?) : Shape definition for the capsule.
density (number?) : Density of the capsule.
friction (number?) : Friction of the capsule.
groupIndex (number?) : Collision group index for the capsule.
categoryBits (number?) : Collision filtering, what 'category' is this in?
maskBits (number?) : Collision filtering, what 'categories' will this collide with?
color (any?) : Custom color for the capsule.
center1 (b2Vec2?) : Center of the first circle of the capsule. Optional if 'height' is set.
center2 (b2Vec2?) : Center of the second circle of the capsule. Optional if 'height' is set.
radius (number?) : Radius of the capsule's circles. Optional if 'width' is set.
fixedRotation (boolean?) : Prevent rotation if set to true.
linearDamping (number?) : Linear damping of velocity.
width (number?) : The overall width of the capsule. If set replaces radius.
height (number?) : The overall height of the capsule, including the start and end caps. If set replaces center1 and center2.

BoxPolygonConfig

BoxPolygonConfig

Type: Object

Properties
worldId (b2WorldId) : ID for the world in which to create the box.
bodyDef (b2BodyDef?) : Body definition for the box.
type (number?) : Type of the body (static, dynamic, kinematic).
position (b2Vec2?) : Position of the box's center.
fixedRotation (boolean?) : Prevent box from rotating?
linearDamping (number?) : Damping for linear velocity.
angularDamping (number?) : Damping for angular velocity.
bodyId (b2BodyId?) : Existing body ID if adding as a fixture.
shapeDef (b2ShapeDef?) : Shape definition for the box.
userData (any?) : The user data to associate with the body.
groupIndex (number?) : Collision group index for the box.
categoryBits (number?) : Collision filtering, what 'category' is this in?
maskBits (number?) : Collision filtering, what 'categories' will this collide with?
density (number?) : Density of the box.
friction (number?) : Friction of the box.
restitution (number?) : Restitution of the box.
color (any?) : Custom color for the box.
preSolve (boolean?) : Enable presolve callback for the circle.
size ((b2Vec2 | number)) : Size of the box (either a b2Vec2 or a single number for square).

b2IntegratePositionsTask

function b2PrepareJointsTask(startIndex, endIndex, context) { const joints = context.joints;

for (let i = startIndex; i < endIndex; ++i) { const joint = joints[i]; joint_h.b2PrepareJoint(joint, context); } }
